title: 1793-A
statement: A. Yet Another Promotiontime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputThe famous store "Second Food" sells groceries only two days a month. And the prices in each of days differ. You wanted to buy $$$n$$$ kilos of potatoes for a month. You know that on the first day of the month $$$1$$$ kilo of potatoes costs $$$a$$$ coins, and on the second day $$$b$$$ coins. In "Second Food" you can buy anyintegerkilograms of potatoes.Fortunately, "Second Food" has announced a promotion for potatoes, which is valid only on the first day of the month — for each $$$m$$$ kilos of potatoes you buy, you get $$$1$$$ kilo as a gift! In other words, you can get $$$m + 1$$$ kilograms by paying for $$$m$$$ kilograms.Find the minimum number of coins that you have to spend to buyat least$$$n$$$ kilos of potatoes.InputEach test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\le t \\le 10\\,000$$$). Description of the test cases follows.The first line of each test case contains two integers $$$a$$$ and $$$b$$$ $$$(1 \\leq a, b \\leq 10^9)$$$ — the prices of $$$1$$$ kilo of potatoes on the first and second days, respectively.The second line contains two integers $$$n$$$ and $$$m$$$ $$$(1 \\leq n, m \\leq 10^9)$$$ — the required amount of potatoes to buy and the amount of potatoes to use the promotion.OutputFor each test case print one integer — the minimum number of coins that you have to pay to buy at least $$$n$$$ kilos of potatoes.ExampleInput55 43 15 43 23 43 520 1510 21000000000 9000000001000000000 8Output9 10 9 135 888888888900000000NoteIn the first test case, on the first day you buy $$$1$$$ kilo and get $$$1$$$ more for a promotion. On the second day, you can buy $$$1$$$ kilo of potatoes. Thus, you will spend $$$5+4=9$$$ coins in total.In the second test case, on the first day you buy $$$2$$$ kilo and get another $$$1$$$ more for a promotion. This way you will spend $$$2 \\cdot 5 = 10$$$ coins.

processed.result:
You need to buy at least $n$ kilograms of potatoes. There are two days in the month when potatoes are sold, with prices of $a$ and $b$ coins per kilogram on the first and second day, respectively. 

On the first day, there is a promotion: for every $m$ kilograms you buy, you get 1 kilogram free.

Find the minimum number of coins you need to spend to buy at least $n$ kilograms of potatoes.

Input:

* $t$: the number of test cases
* For each test case:
    * $a$: price per kilogram on the first day
    * $b$: price per kilogram on the second day
    * $n$: the required amount of potatoes
    * $m$: the amount of potatoes needed to trigger the promotion

Output:

* For each test case, print the minimum number of coins needed to buy at least $n$ kilograms of potatoes.

You need to buy at least *n* units of an item. There are two days to buy it, with different prices. On the first day, you get a bonus of one unit for every *m* units you buy. Find the cheapest way to buy at least *n* units.
